016package edu.cnm.deepdive.codebreaker.viewmodel;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.SharedPreferences;
020import android.content.res.Resources;
021import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
022import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
023import androidx.lifecycle.Transformations;
024import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
025import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
026import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
027import edu.cnm.deepdive.codebreaker.R;
028import edu.cnm.deepdive.codebreaker.service.PreferencesRepository;
029import javax.inject.Inject;
030import kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1;
031
032/**
033 * Provides access (for a UI controller or data-bound view) to some subset of the current
034 * preferences state. While {@link PreferencesRepository} provides access to the full
035 * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences} of the app, this class takes the approach of using
036 * {@link Transformations#map(LiveData, Function1)} to provide {@link LiveData}-based read-only
037 * access to individual preference values. This approach is of most use when an instance of a
038 * {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass is used to modify
039 * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences}, and the preference values need to be used (but not
040 * modified) in other UI controllers.
041 */
042@HiltViewModel
043public class PreferencesViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
044
045private final LiveData<Integer> preferedCodeLength;
046
047  private final LiveData<Integer> preferedGamesThreshold;
048
049  @Inject
050  PreferencesViewModel(@ApplicationContext Context context, PreferencesRepository repository) {
051    LiveData<SharedPreferences> prefs = repository.getPreferences();
052    // TODO Initialize LiveData fields (as needed) for individual preferences.
053    Resources res = context.getResources();
054
055    String codeLengthKey = res.getString(R.string.code_length_key);
056    int codeLengthDefault = res.getInteger(R.integer.code_length_default);
057    LiveData<Integer> rawCodeLength =
058        Transformations.map(prefs, (pr) -> pr.getInt(codeLengthKey, codeLengthDefault));
059    preferedCodeLength = Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(rawCodeLength);
060
061    String gamesThresholdKey = res.getString(R.string.games_threshold_key);
062    int gamesThresholdDefault = res.getInteger(R.integer.games_threshold_default);
063    LiveData<Integer> rawGamesThreshold =
064        Transformations.map(prefs, (pr)-> pr.getInt(gamesThresholdKey, gamesThresholdDefault));
065    preferedGamesThreshold = Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(rawGamesThreshold);
066  }
067
068  public LiveData<Integer> getPreferedCodeLength() {
069    return preferedCodeLength;
070  }
071
072
073  public LiveData<Integer> getPreferedGamesThreshold() {
074    return preferedGamesThreshold;
075  }
076
077}
